summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between individuals, likely prosecutors and/or law enforcement, discussing the scheduling and background for an interview with a witness or victim related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails reference a second victim who reported being sexually assaulted by an individual named 'Black' at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain discusses a 'spinoff interview from Maxwell,' indicating the interview is related to or derived from the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Black
persons.context: Described as the individual who sexually assaulted a second victim at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001 in a manner similar to another victim.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the owner of the Manhattan townhouse where an alleged sexual assault by 'Black' occurred in 2001.

connections.description: Black is alleged to have sexually assaulted a victim at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse, indicating a connection to Epstein's property and activities.
The 'spinoff interview' is from the Maxwell case, which is centrally linked to Jeffrey Epstein's activities.

events.title: Alleged assault at Epstein townhouse
events.description: A second victim reported being sexually assaulted by an individual named 'Black' at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse.

events.title: Tentative witness interview scheduled
events.description: An interview with a witness/victim, a spinoff from the Maxwell case, was tentatively scheduled for May 18, 2021, to decide on opening an investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: A second victim reported being sexually assaulted by an individual named 'Black' at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001.
Law enforcement was coordinating a 'spinoff interview' related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case to decide whether to open a new investigation.
The email correspondence involves scheduling and background discussions for this interview, indicating ongoing investigative activity in 2021.
The correspondence originates from or involves the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
